Brogden To Perform

Marshall Brogden has recovered
from his nose injury sustained in
the Varsity Club fracas, and will
tend the net against Army. During his enforced absence Cliff Gilbert has developed rapidly and obtained valuable experience which
will enable him to fill in whenever
needed in the impending difficult
struggles.
Swarthmore never had a chance
in its vain attempt to halt the BlueThe
jays' triumphant march.
Homewood attack struck with
deadly force in the first five minutes
of play, scoring four points before
the Garnet could organize themselves in order to meet this charge.
The only remaining doubt in the
minds of the large group of spectators concerned the one-sidedness of
the ultimate margin of victory.

Jay Trackmen Face
Busiest Week-End
Of Current Season
To Compete In Penn Relays Saturday; Meet Haverford College
This Afternoon
Coach Waldo Hambleton's Bluejay track squad will face its busiest
week-end of the season today and
tomorrow when it journeys to Pennsylvania. A strong Haverford College team will furnish the opposition this afternoon, and tomorrow
Hopkins will be represented in the
Penn Relays at Philadelphia.
Gettysburg University proved
easy for the Jays last Saturday and
succumbed by an 85-41 count. The
Bullets were able to secure hut four
first places in the fourteen events,
finishing on top in the 100 and 220,
the javzlin, and the pole vault.

Early in the 17th century, tobacco seed
from America was taken to Turkey. Different soil,
different climate, different temperatures night
and day,and different farming methods produced
an entirely new tobacco—small in size, but very
rich and aromatic.
Four certain spots are famous for the quality
Xanthi and Cavalla in
oftheir Turkish tobacco

Greece; Samsoun and Smyrna in Turkey. And it
is principally from these places that our buyers
get the Turkish for Chesterfield.
These Turkish tobaccos are blended,in just the
right amount, with Domestic tobaccos. It is this
blending and cross-blendingofjustthe rightamount
of Turkish and Domestic tobaccos which gives
Chesterfield a flavor that neither possesses alone.

Brogden To Perform

Marshall Brogden has recovered
from his nose injury sustained in
the Varsity Club fracas, and will
tend the net against Army. During his enforced absence Cliff Gilbert has developed rapidly and obtained valuable experience which
will enable him to fill in whenever
needed in the impending difficult
struggles.
Swarthmore never had a chance
in its vain attempt to halt the BlueThe
jays' triumphant march.
Homewood attack struck with
deadly force in the first five minutes
of play, scoring four points before
the Garnet could organize themselves in order to meet this charge.
The only remaining doubt in the
minds of the large group of spectators concerned the one-sidedness of
the ultimate margin of victory.

Jay Trackmen Face
Busiest Week-End
Of Current Season
To Compete In Penn Relays Saturday; Meet Haverford College
This Afternoon
Coach Waldo Hambleton's Bluejay track squad will face its busiest
week-end of the season today and
tomorrow when it journeys to Pennsylvania. A strong Haverford College team will furnish the opposition this afternoon, and tomorrow
Hopkins will be represented in the
Penn Relays at Philadelphia.
Gettysburg University proved
easy for the Jays last Saturday and
succumbed by an 85-41 count. The
Bullets were able to secure hut four
first places in the fourteen events,
finishing on top in the 100 and 220,
the javzlin, and the pole vault.

Early in the 17th century, tobacco seed
from America was taken to Turkey. Different soil,
different climate, different temperatures night
and day,and different farming methods produced
an entirely new tobacco—small in size, but very
rich and aromatic.
Four certain spots are famous for the quality
Xanthi and Cavalla in
oftheir Turkish tobacco

Greece; Samsoun and Smyrna in Turkey. And it
is principally from these places that our buyers
get the Turkish for Chesterfield.
These Turkish tobaccos are blended,in just the
right amount, with Domestic tobaccos. It is this
blending and cross-blendingofjustthe rightamount
of Turkish and Domestic tobaccos which gives
Chesterfield a flavor that neither possesses alone.
